attributes.action: Make Gift Aid easier for donors and recipients with a single, simple mechanism
attributes.background: The mechanism to provide Gift Aid to a charity is too complex, takes too much effort and fails too often.  It is almost like the Government does not want to provide Gift Aid. Everyone would benefit is this were simpler, and more successful with a single, easy, standard mechanism.
attributes.additional_details:
Often people are put off donating because of Gift Aid complexities, Gift Aid fails or people get overburdened by different Gift Aid cards etc. Charities waste money dealing with complex Gift Aid processes.

Ideally, there would be a single, simple mechanism to provide Gift Aid. This could be a single card type mechanism provided by Charities (recognised by Government and Charities). Alternatively, a unique identifier (eg a ‘Gift Aid’ number or possibly the NI number) would be sufficient.

attributes.action: Simplify the legal process of buying and selling a home
attributes.background: Buying and selling a home in the U.K. is an overly complicated, slow, and frustrating process. Introduce a single body to deal with 'searches' (Land Registry?), create an online system to track progress and facilitate communication, and reduce the ability of parties to make changes prior to exchange
attributes.additional_details: The current system has barely changed in decades. Solicitors still communicate via post, creating huge delays waiting for various documents to be passed between parties. Too many separate entities need to be consulted, often to confirm obvious or know facts. The existing system provides no incentive to reform the process as it generates significant 'easy money' for solicitors, estate agents and others, with buyers and sellers lacking the knowledge to challenge the process.

attributes.action: Remove all American military bases from UK soil.
attributes.background: A relic of the second world war, the UK is littered with underused American military bases, thousands of acres of beautiful UK countryside is being left to waste with no advantage to the UK at all, it's just waste land, not even wildlife is welcome.
attributes.additional_details:
The United States has thousands of acres of UK soil for their own military use which is of very little advantage to us, they provide minimal economic benefits or defence as they are self sufficient and more likely to attract enemies to our shores.
 These bases are generally in prime locations and could be used in countless ways to boost our economy, housing, farming or simply given back to nature to enhance our countryside. American military bases are of no use to the UK, take our country back.

attributes.action: Reinstate George Osborne's plan to set up a 2nd hand annuity market
attributes.background: People have been waiting nearly two years to be able to sell their poor monthly payments for cash lump sums where they can make a difference to their lives.   For example, I've sat with no working boiler as I can't afford one without my annuity funds in one payment.

attributes.action: Allow intended parents of surrogate children, to have legal right from birth,
attributes.background: When surrogates are used they have the legal right to keep that child even if they have no biological connection, I want intended parents to have legal right of the child from birth to give more people a chance to have a child without fear of it the surrogate keeping them.

attributes.action: Any future referendum vote on Scottish Independence must be given to all the UK.
attributes.background: The United Kingdom is exactly that..United.  As part of a legal union Scotland should NOT be able to decide alone on independence as the consequences will affect ALL of the UK economically and politically.

attributes.action: Stop the  plans, to use the hard shoulder on motorways, as an additional lane.
attributes.background: The plans to use the hard shoulder, on motorways, as an additional lane, is ill conceived and very dangerous. The hard shoulder is an EMERGENCY lane and should be kept as such. The emergency  and breakdown services will not be able to help drivers in the event of an accident or breakdown.
attributes.additional_details: I believe the emergency/breakdown services and motoring organisations, have already expressed their concern.

attributes.action: End disability discrimination through Essential Criteria for Driving Licences.
attributes.background: At present, there is no law preventing a role where the primary function is as a driver, or in the Emergency and Armed Services, to be distinct from a role requiring travel, both having an "Essential Criteria" for a "Full UK Driving licence", thus allowing for selective discrimination of disability.
attributes.additional_details:
Roles that require travel such as the following: 
https://roles.mariecurie.org.uk/VacancyInformation.aspx?VId=58439
are discriminating against disabilities whose condition affect their eligibility to drive.
While there are professions, that should be exempt, such as roles where the primary function is driving, or in Emergency and Armed Services roles, we ask parliament for roles outside these selected professions to apply to be able to list a "UK Driving Licence" as an "essential job criteria".

attributes.action: Abolish psychiatric electroconvulsive therapy – ECT - electroshock to the brain
attributes.background: ECT causes brain cell death, brain bleed and swelling. It can cause permanent memory loss, cognitive impairment and even death. It can trigger suicide. ECT machines have never been independently inspected or approved for medical safety, not even by the regulators for the UK - MHRA or the US – FDA.
attributes.additional_details: Electroconvulsive therapy (ECT) is a psychiatric procedure where up to 400 volts is put through the brain for up to 8 seconds causing an epileptic fit purportedly to relieve mental distress.   Mainly given to women and the elderly, sometimes to children and often without consent.  Patients are rarely fully informed about the potential harm.  Dr Peter Breggin states ECT produces a ‘closed head injury high’ www.ectresources.org. Abolish ECT. www.speakoutagainstpsychiatry.org

attributes.action: Make it illegal for schools to force pupils to sing religious songs
attributes.background: It is still legal to let a school punish students (through detentions ect...) for not singing religious songs when the songs doesn't apply to their religion or they're not religious at all... this outdated law should be removed
attributes.additional_details: The law states that religious and non religious schools must take part in some form of collective worship and that it must only be of christian character which isn't reflective of the demographic

attributes.action: Remove Chris Brown's ban from entering the United Kingdom
attributes.background:
Due to the incident involving Rihanna in 2009, Chris Brown was banned from entering the United Kingdom as a result of his 5 year probation. 

Chris Brown was relieved of his probation last year and has not had a major run in with the police since.

He has the right to be allowed in the Uk.
attributes.additional_details:
May 27th 2014 - His daughter was born. Chris Brown has proven to be a good role model since the birth of his daughter. 

Chris Brown suffers from Bipolar Disorder and PTSD

attributes.action: Monday November 12 2018  be a UK  National Public Holiday to mark the end of WW1
attributes.background: During the past four years the Gov and the UK have been commemorating many events associated with the First World War - now as we near the 100th anniversary of its end , make the Monday nearest to Remembrance Day a National Holiday for people to reflect on the conflict that had just eneded

attributes.action: Hold a parliamentary debate on the re-introduction of selective State Education
attributes.background: The Government has announced the return of selection in Secondary Education in England without any manifesto commitment or mandate to do so and 40 years after it was abolished as socially divisive and intrinsically unfair to the economically less advantaged.
attributes.additional_details: The Prime Minister argues that the re-introduction of grammar schools will enhance social mobility. However the evidence on the ground in those few areas where selective education remains entrenched is that though it may do so for the lucky few, many more are left behind. Selection favours affluent families who pay for the extra coaching to pass the selection tests and obstructs access for the poorest.

attributes.action: Permanently move Parliament to a more UK population central location.
attributes.background: The seat of power in the UK has for too long resided in a place inaccessible to most of the country. This has resulted in generations of regional underinvestment and the revenue creation capacity of our country massively skewed to financial services in the City, Greater London and the South East
attributes.additional_details: With a new parliament location a more commutable distance, we can also do away with the cost of many second homes for MPs. The £40+Billion cost of HS2 can be reallocated to pay for a new Parliament building (The final cost of Holyrood was put at £414M) and the renewal of the rail infrastructure to support it. After hundreds of years of revenue flowing from the rest of the UK to the South East, it’s about time it started seeding sustainable growth elsewhere.

attributes.action: Enable Police and Telephone services to trace and prosecute cold callers.
attributes.background: Cold calling is supposed to be illegal, TPS is not a deterrent, so the Police, trading Standards and Telephone service providers should be compelled to cooperate to trace, arrest, and prosecute offenders. A help line should be created for reporting offending numbers.
attributes.additional_details: In this digital world, it should be possible to trace who purchased any number. Citizens can bar withheld numbers to prevent some calls, but there is a problem with normal numbers. These must be held on record by service providers. They must be traceable to a specific location.

attributes.action: Make learning a foreign language compulsory from the 1st year of primary school
attributes.background: The UK has one of the lowest levels of multi-linguistic speakers. By keeping up with our European neighbours we will open up travel for the individual and business for the nation. The best way to learn a foreign language is to learn continuously from a young age, when the brain is most capable.
attributes.additional_details: Communication is key in international business and the UK government wishes to see more students taking up a foreign language at university. To facilitate a future nation of polyglots we need to prioritise foreign language as a core subject for children. Starting from the age of 5, or younger, when it's easiest to learn, and to be taught continuously through to adolescence so that every future adult has at least basic secondary language skills.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for data companies to sell any personal data to any third party.
attributes.background: I receive in the region of 10-15 cold-calls every day. These calls cannot currently be blocked by BT and are only subject to Telephone Preference if made within the UK.
attributes.additional_details: If these calls were being made within the UK, and assuming that the person receiving them has signed up to TPS, then the company making the call could be prosecuted, as could the company who sold the data, because they had not made the required checks against the TPS data base. Unfortunately, this does not apply to overseas call centres. However, if the companies that sell this data were closed down, eventually the problem would stop.

attributes.action: Instruct Southern Rail to reinvest all profits until they can run a full service
attributes.background: Southern Rail have been running a minimal and intermittant service while harvesting almost £100m in profit. Many of us will have had sympathy that they were dealing with a difficult situation with engineering work and civil action, however news that they are making such a profit shows otherwise.

attributes.action: Stop doctors striking and withdrawing emergency care
attributes.background: We ask that the government make it illegal for people who work within the medical profession to withdraw from work and strike for more than 24 hours consecutively.   We also request that anyone doing so be struck off for intentionally causing distress and refusing to treat patients

attributes.action: Introduce banking skills to the secondary curriculum.
attributes.background: I believe that it is important that the use of banking services be a mandatory part of the secondary school curriculum as it would appear, from anecdotal reports and observation that many teenagers simply do not understand how to use basic banking services.

attributes.action: Educate society about Epilepsy and eradicate the stigma surrounding it
attributes.background: More than 500,000 people in the UK have epilepsy, which is a condition that affects the brain and causes repetitive seizures. There is a stigma around epilepsy that needs to be addressed, starting with the lack of knowledge the public have about what to do when someone has a seizure.
attributes.additional_details: Educating children from a young age in a First Aid class would severely decrease the stigma around epilepsy and therefore allow those with epilepsy to feel more accepted in the community. By placing a programme of First Aid in primary and secondary schools where children learn about what to do when witnessing a seizure- not touching the person or placing anything in their mouths etc- would make epilepsy a much less lonely and frightening condition.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to exclude Legal Expenses cover against Financial Institutions
attributes.background: Family legal expenses policies commonly sold by insurance companies as an add on for about £30 specifically exclude taking any legal action against any insurance company or bank for any insurance contract, savings, pension or investment policy. This should be outlawed as an unfair contract condition
attributes.additional_details: The insurance industry has created a self protection society to the consumer's detriment. The Government has heavily criticised the FCA and the Ombudsman they created and often reach a decisions different to the law. The consumer is at their mercy as without legal expenses cover they can't afford to take action against arrogant, big boy bully insurance providers who just tell the consumer to go away. These policies are consequently worthless in this regard one of the biggest industries in the UK

attributes.action: Legalise the age of buying and smoking e-juice to 14 with parental consent
attributes.background: Vaping and smoking e-juices do not harm kids! I'm 14 years old and I stopped smoking and moved onto e-juice. This is much less harmful then cigarettes and maybe more kids might stop smoking if the legal age was dropped.

attributes.action: Changes to the Dangerous Dogs Act 1991.
attributes.background: Many dogs that are confiscated are done so because they look dangerous or because of their breed specification; Pit Bull Terrier, Staffordshire Bull Terrier, I believe that they should only be destroyed if they commit an act that deems them dangerous (full on attack on a child or vulnerable person)
attributes.additional_details: What I believe should happen is that when a dog commits a crime such as attacking a child they are to be put on a 2 stage warning system, the dog is then taken for an behaviour assessment and the owners property is assessed for welfare standards. If the dog then commits the act again more serious action can be taken to change the behaviour such as rehousing the dog to a different family to see if the dog with change then if this option has failed then the dog can be destroyed.

attributes.action: make naloxone available to all opiate / opioid users in the uk.
attributes.background: I myself have almost lost my life to opiate overdoses and I have lost friends to opiate overdoses. lets do our best to stop this. This drug has absolutely no effect on people without opiates / opioids in their system.
attributes.additional_details: Naloxone is a medication used to counter the effects of opioid overdose Specifically, naloxone is used in opioid overdoses to counteract life-threatening depression of the central nervous system and respiratory system, allowing an overdose victim to breathe normally. Naloxone only works if a person has opioids in their system; the medication has no effect if opioids are absent. Naloxone has no potential for abuse.  It is a temporary drug that wears off in 20-90 minutes. (harmreduction.org)

attributes.action: Levy £1.00 tax on non recyclable coffee cups and give proceeds to NHS.
attributes.background: Britain throws away 2 500 000 000 coffee cups a year which cannot be recycled. The technology exists to make them recyclable. This tax will make it an economic necessity for the BIG coffee companies to act.
attributes.additional_details: Reference BBC1 program presented by Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall "War on waste" 21:00 July 28 2016.

attributes.action: Arm all police officers with firearms, to deter and limit impact of terrorism.
attributes.background: The ability to rapidly deal with armed terrorists cannot be met by specialist units alone. Having a rapid, local, armed response is crucial to limiting the damage terrorists can do. This can only be achieved by arming all police officers.

attributes.action: Take down all "no ball games" signs; children should be outside having fun!
attributes.background: The government needs to review the use of "no ball games" signs throughout the country. We are at a cross-roads, we either allow child obesity to continue at its epidemic rate, or encourage children to play and exercise as much as possible to bring these rates down.

attributes.action: Allow first time home buyers to pay stamp duty in installments.
attributes.background: Stamp duty for first time buyers makes buying a new home prohibitive for many. The government should allow first time buyers to pay it installments, rather than having to pay it up front.
attributes.additional_details: Buying a new home is extremely difficult due to the enormous up front cost of the deposit. Even with the governmental schemes to help prospective new home owners stamp duty still poses a major hurdle to every first time home buyer. Allow them to pay it in installments.

attributes.action: Raise the speed limit of the motorway to unlimited
attributes.background: In Germany I realized how efficient and well maintained the highways were and how advanced the "Autobahns" are similar to the "smart" motorways we have in the UK. I believe we should have a system in place where in certain areas of the motorway it should have an unrestricted speed limit.
attributes.additional_details: 6% of deaths occur on British motorways and 40% in urban roads. a further 54% of deaths occur on rural roads. compared with Germany their motorway deaths stand at 12%, 60% on rural roads and 28% in urban areas. I believe we should use the same system where we can adjust the speed limit to the road conditions using the smart motorways (such as limiting the motorway to 70mph in wet conditions etc) and introducing unlimited speed limits in quiet times such as 9pm-8am. This would allow less accidents down rural roads as there is a safer place to speed (as shown by statistics)

attributes.action: Debit card charges to be set at a fair level and charges itemised on  reciept .
attributes.background:
Shop can currently charge what ever they like if a card is used .
goverment should set a max fee and ensure the fee charged is itemised on reciept

attributes.action: Government to take full admittance on the 'tainted blood scandal' & an apology.
attributes.background: The "Tainted Blood Scandal" is the event of nearly 5,000 people being infected with the Hepatitis C and 1,200 being infected with HIV, often during treatment for Haemophilia or Blood Transfusion by the NHS in the 1970s and 1980s and the subsequent government reaction.
attributes.additional_details:
Despite numerous calls from campaigners, victims and MP's over the years, successive governments in Westminster have refused to hold a Public Inquiry into the matter.

To date no government, health or pharmaceutical entity in the UK has admitted liability for the scandal and no compensation has been paid to those infected or affected. Compensation has been paid in Ireland.

attributes.action: Introduce better benefits for stay at home parents.
attributes.background: Child care is very expensive which means some parents decided to live off one wage and have a stay at home Mum or Dad for their child. I feel that there is not enough financial help from the government for stay at home parents.Sometimes the wage of one isn't enough.

attributes.action: Pass legislation to restrict betting on referenda and general elections.
attributes.background: Shortly before the EU Referendum, bookmakers' odds for Remain were 1/4, while those for Leave were 5/1. Such odds have the potential to influence voting, irrespective of the political issues at stake. It is reported that 69 per cent of individual bets were placed on Leave.
attributes.additional_details:
Reference: Financial Times dated 26 June 2016
"Brexit wagers set new record for non-sports bets" by Paul McClean.

attributes.action: Make the Chilcot Enquiry free to the public instead of costing £767
attributes.background: Taxpayers money funded the work of the Chilcot enquiry so why are we now being charged £767 for the findings?  It should be free.  The average wage in the UK is £26,500 which means that an average person would have to spend 43% of their monthly post-tax income to get access.  This is wrong.

attributes.action: All companies relocating to the EU to pay all tax owing to the exchequer.
attributes.background: Vodafone may quit the UK as a result of the Brexit refrendum. HMRC did a deal with them recently. If any company relocates to within the EU, HMRC must annul any deals made, audit them properly and they must pay all tax owing from the last ten years plus interest immediately.

attributes.action: Start working on a drive through tunnel for the Isle of Wight to help the locals
attributes.background: A fixed link drive through tunnel will help the locals, businesses, tourism and the economy of the Island and stop the ferry companies over pricing  the poor and slow service plus it will create employment and boost the Island as a great holiday destination for many many years to come.

attributes.action: UK practical driving test time to be reduced.
attributes.background: 40 minutes for a driving test is a long time to sit in a car with an examiner looking at you throughout the test. Many people fail their test not because their bad drivers but because their nervous and sweaty.
attributes.additional_details:
Sitting in an exam is hard as it is, but sitting one in a car with an examiner next to guy watching at everything you do is another thing. I think the driving test time should be reduced to at least 20-30 minutes. 

Many people fail their test because their nervous and don't know what the examiner is writing, it puts the learner under a lot of stress and end up failing their tests. £62 is a lot of money to spend every time you fail and have to rebook a test. Reducing the time will be good.

attributes.action: Investigate UK areas of deep social dislocation and propose remedial measures
attributes.background: The result of the EU Referendum on 23 June revealed significant differences between different parts of the UK. Polls also revealed sharply constrasting social circumstances and motivations for the different votes. There appears to be a causative correlation between vote and social circumstances.
attributes.additional_details:
The poll conducted by Lord Ashcroft shows significant social, educational and age differences between the two sides of the EU Referendum votes: http://lordashcroftpolls.com/2016/06/how-the-united-kingdom-voted-and-why/
The differences in the voting in different parts of the country are readily available.

attributes.action: Make the drink driving law more strict or introduce a zero tolerance policy.
attributes.background:
Every year, over 250 people are killed on UK roads and over 7,000 casualties from drink driving. In 2013, 683,651 roadside breath tests were carried out by the police, which 71,675 drivers
or riders failed or refused to take the test. Many of these are due to people driving the morning after.
attributes.additional_details: We, the undersigned suggest that people refer to the horrific facts shown in the RoSPA July 2015 "Drinking and Driving" report to see that even just 1 accident, injury or even death is too many. A reform of the law should be considered to lower the limit or introduce a zero tolerance on the matter. Thus to save the lives of countless people horrifically torn away from their families in such awful circumstances.

attributes.action: Don't scrap the right to buy on uk council homes
attributes.background:
Don't  scrap  the right to buy scheme for uk council homes 


The right to buy  is the only way most people will ever get on the housing ladder

attributes.action: The Government to establish the workings of Article 50 TEU before invocation.
attributes.background: Article 50 of the EU describes the method of how a country leaves the EU. There is insufficient information within the text of the article to properly understand how the mechanics of it would work. The government should seek answers to all outstanding questions prior to invocation.
attributes.additional_details: The biggest outstanding questions is whether or not an article 50 invocation can be withdrawn or not. Others are around the scope of what can be negotiated and what needs to be agreed before the conclusion of article 50. The Government should establish all outstanding questions from the public and seek answers from the EU before article 50 is ever invoked.

attributes.action: Discuss a National Coalition government after the EU referendum result
attributes.background: Britain exiting the EU is the biggest challenge to face the UK since World War Two. Unity is required and there are concerns of a rise in too far to the right politics.
attributes.additional_details: Exiting Europe is the biggest challenge to face the UK since World War Two. A rise in racism and contempt has been reported by immigrants and by people of a minority ethnicity and I feel the British people need reassurances that the goverment won't be led too far right. A Tory lead coalition government with Labour and SNP should be discussed. I feel the coalition will offer stability and offer the best negotiations for the British people when exiting the EU.

attributes.action: Open age restrictions for Lifetime ISA
attributes.background:
Allow to open and contribute until 50 years old
Currently only available to 18 to 40 years of age
Pays 25% bonus pa on £4k

attributes.action: Bring back milk for primary school children
attributes.background: When I was younger we always had a small milk bottle with a straw. I think it's really important for children to get calcium and in this busy day and age ensures that all children get some milk.

attributes.action: Ensure that all bureaucrats involved in EU exit talks are elected non-experts
attributes.background:
The British people have demonstrated their desire to free themselves from government by unelected bureaucrats and so-called experts.
The will of the people must be respected: all those involved in EU exit negotiations should have no expertise and should be elected directly to the role.
attributes.additional_details:
Much of the campaign to leave the EU focused on our lives being run by unelected bureaucrats and the 'misinformation' provided by experts. The massive 3.8% majority for leave in the referendum is a clear mandate to end the negative influence of unelected bureaucrats and experts.
Anyone involved in EU exit talks should be directly elected. Given the timeframe of the negotiations, their terms of office should be for 8 months, allowing us to assess their performance and get rid of them if need be.

attributes.action: During referendums all politicians swear before a judge to tell the whole truth
attributes.background: the public should be able to take demonstratable factual evidence from politicians on important subjects usually called in referendums. The politicians should clearly state what are facts and what is speculation & as in a court should be asked to swear an oath which supports this.
attributes.additional_details: The 2016 EU referendum on either was clearly not based on a facts or truths. This has the potential for causing great harm.

attributes.action: Declare EU referendum void as 16 & 17 year olds were denied the vote
attributes.background: The EU referendum is a significant constitutional event.  It will affect the rights and opportunities of all UK citizens for many years to come. The 16 & 17 year old should have been given a vote. The precedent for this already having been established for the recent Scottish Independence referendum.
attributes.additional_details: The size of the youth vote is large enough to have had a material effect on the outcome of the election

attributes.action: Make Government & Politics an optional GCSE subject
attributes.background: Government & Politics is currently not an existing GCSE qualification, with increased voter apathy in particular amongst young people, giving them the tools to engage in the political process, should they wish, from an earlier age than currently exists may increase political participation.
attributes.additional_details: In the EU Referendum (2016) voter turnout amongst 18-24 year olds was 36% (@SkyData), however the turnout for the referendum as a whole was 72% showing voter apathy to be particular prevalent amongst the young.

attributes.action: To implement a national standard for the design of cycle lanes by cyclists.
attributes.background: A lot of money has been spent recently on local cycle schemes that have been very poorly implimented; therefore not having the desired effect and in some places making the roads more dangerous for all road users. I believe there should be a national standard for the design of cycle routes and paths.
attributes.additional_details:
£29 million cycle route with very poor sections - http://www.yorkshireeveningpost.co.uk/news/design-of-flagship-29m-leeds-to-bradford-cycle-superhighway-will-set-cycling-back-1-7916928
Some photos of poorly placed cycle lanes -https://www.theguardian.com/environment/gallery/2009/nov/05/readers-worst-cycle-https://www.buzzfeed.com/jonstone/22-london-cycle-lanes-that-hate-cyclists?utm_term=.fee8zBePA#.qta6MxrlB
